t: Psalm 94
The Just Judge
Lord,*spn God of vengeance — God*ln of vengeance, shine!
Rise*ln up, Judge of the earth; repay*ln the proud what they deserve.
Lord,*sln how long will the wicked — how*ln long will the wicked celebrate?
They*pn pour out arrogant words; all*ln the evildoers boast.
Lord,*sln they crush your people; they*ln oppress your heritage.
They*ln kill the widow and the resident alien and*ln murder the fatherless.
They*ln say, “The Lord*s doesn’t see it. The*ln God of Jacob doesn’t pay attention.”
Pay*pn attention, you stupid people! Fools,*ln when will you be wise?
Can*ln the one who shaped the ear not hear, the*ln one who formed the eye not see?
The*ln one who instructs nations, the*ln one who teaches mankind knowledge — does*ln he not discipline?
The*ln Lord*s knows the thoughts of mankind; they*ln are futile.
Lord,*spn how happy is anyone you discipline and*ln teach from your law
to*ln give him relief from troubled times until*ln a pit is dug for the wicked.
The*ln Lord*s will not leave his people or*ln abandon his heritage,
for*ln the administration of justice will again be righteous, and*ln all the upright in heart will follow it.
Who*pn stands up for me against the wicked? Who*ln takes a stand for me against evildoers?
If*ln the Lord*s had not been my helper, I*ln would soon rest in the silence of death.
If*ln I say, “My foot is slipping,” your*ln faithful love will support me, Lord.*s
When*ln I am filled with cares, your*ln comfort brings me joy.
Can*pn a corrupt throne be your ally, a*ln throne that makes evil laws?
They*ln band together against the life of the righteous and*ln condemn the innocent to death.
But*ln the Lord*s is my refuge; my*ln God is the rock of my protection.
He*ln will pay them back for their sins and*ln destroy them for their evil. The*ln Lord*s our God will destroy them.
